pr_title: add registry column to image table

timeline.bodyText: Real nit-picky, but maybe Registry the image belongs to? At first glance I read Registry image as noun phrase
timeline.author: coverbeck

timeline.bodyText: You don't need to create an intermediate Set; you can just add the image directly by calling tag.getImages().add(<image>).
timeline.author: coverbeck

timeline.bodyText: Same, you don't need intermediate set
timeline.author: coverbeck

timeline.bodyText: Following up on my previous comments, if this always returns a max of one Image (?), then the method should return an Optional and not a Set.
timeline.author: coverbeck
garyluu

timeline.bodyText:
Should this just use an Enum?
See Organization.status for an example.
The enum would seem to just be io.dockstore.common.Registry
timeline.author: denis-yuen

timeline.bodyText:
Comment above seems to be out-of-date now.
I guess the bigger issue is I don't understand how/if this deals with paging and the identified problem that we may need to page through a large number of tags in order to get images.
timeline.author: denis-yuen

replies.bodyText: yeah, that is in another ticket https://ucsc-cgl.atlassian.net/browse/DOCK-1211
replies.author: NatalieEO

timeline.message: remove toString in Registry enum so openapi matches swagger
